spanGrp.span: nzo.ne mi.ya.tha mon.me rä ma.ne.nzo zə ŋaf.yə the.bräk.nath ʔa.ne.nzo nə thre.bräk.nə
I only know (the ones), that my fathers have called out. I will only call the names of those.
may.ʔa.wa mər.mər.ma ʔo may.ʔa.wa.ma ka.far ma.ne thwam.nzə.rəm ya.si nzo.ne ʔa.ki
they were from inside the mayawas or from the mayawas. yasi, my grandfather
ba.gu fi tü.fər.wä thwam.nzə.rəm fi ba.gu.ʔan.me ka.far ma.ne swam.nzə.rəm
the bagus were really plenty. from the bagus the big man stayed there
?o.kay ʔa.ne ʔe.tha mə.rən mər.mə.ren ʔa.ne fof thwam.nzə.rəm fi wo.ga ka.be tü.fər thwam.nzə.rəm
okay, inside those three clans there were plenty of people
mere = village south of safs; bobafa = on that side; zbafa = on this side; but the corresponding forms don't exist: bobofo bobafo, zbofo zbafo, and neither bobofa or zbofa
as for those who came from mere
thafrakési = mix; could be wartha kambeyä; faremä, safsä "with them", firrangä = with firra people
they mixed up with the wartha people
PHON maybe also check ntrari vs. ntérari
sa.fəs ka.be ze.na ma.ne ʔe.ko.nzə.rəth nzra.ri
now they call them safs people, nzrari
as for those who stayed in nzrari
those were the people that came
who killed the people in firra
okay, when that war was taking place
nzo.ne ŋa.fe fə.thə fof ka.tan fäth səf.rä.rəm
my father was a young baby boy
ni.ma ze.na zəf thrä.kwə.rəth ʔe.bar zan
nə.ge nzo.ne ŋa.fe ʔa.ne fof kwo.zi
na.fä fof zen.fa.rath zi.zi fe.fe fə.thə ʔe.foth kwab.tha.kwə.rəm
he left with him in the late afternoon when the sun was going down
fi zə mi.ya.tha zä.ko.ra na.fa.ne.mä.wä bad yam.me
mbant yam = ground action "magic", nafnemäwä = with his own
he already knew with his own magic
ni.ma ze.na kwa zan zə.bo ŋa.thor.thər ka.be kwa ze.na ʔef.nzə.rəth fir.ran
like this "today the killing is coming in" or "they will kill the people today in firra."
sra.nək ni kra.fa.re sran.kəf ze.naf.tha ke.ke ʔe.foth zi.zi fe.fe rä nzä kay.ʔə wo.rä.ro
"srank, we set off" srank said: "no, it is late afternoon. I will come tomorrow."
wa.tik fi z# ya.si ma.ne ya.ra fi fe.fe zen.fa.ra ma.su
oh well... as for yasi, he really came to masu
he thought of the people at masu
kar.bu ʔo.te ma.ne fo.bo thwam.nzə.rəm ʔa.ne ba.da.ba.da
karbu and ote who were living over there. those ancestors
tétéfér = ntambe = name of a person
the big ones from the mayawa
wa.tik fi ʔa.ne fə zen.fa.ra ʔa.ne mi.ya.than ʔa.ne zi.zi
ane fé = ane féfé; without wasting time
he set off without knowing that this afternoon
the headhunters arrive. in the night
kérsi = block, nwir = attack; fixed expression not with other word than krsi
they were already blocking the place for the attack
the village was in the middle, in the night they came inside
as for srank and his little brother
they hit him and he fell down
but they did not fully kill him
they looked around for the small bamboo to cut his neck
zə zä.bri.ma.koth tho.gər thwa.re.nzə.rəm sra.nək fə.thə ma.ne ya.ra
the returned to look for the bamboo knife. but as for srank ...
they had really already killed his small brother
wa.tik sra.nək nä.bi ya.si fam san.ra ya.si yən.bra.gwa ma.su
he only thought of yasi. he followed yasi to masu
naf fof zä.tri.fa fo.bo ni.ma fir.ran zə thä.kwə.rəth
there he told them "the already killed them in firra."
when he was shouting at the river
in masu from the other side
rófäsi (akrimogo language, ranar) = rafisi (Komnzo) = rafise (Wära); sarafith CHECK
mezsi = pick up, bring; sanmisé (firra) = sanmesé (rouku)
"they should have killed him, those headhunters"
wa.tik sra.nək tər.tha byara sra.nək nə.ge.mä.re
he never had any children, it's not the case that his children were killed
srank was alive, but without children
ʔa.ne ʔe.foth yföyfön fə.thə kwankwirmth fo.ba kwan.far.kwə.rə.məth
within those days, when they ran away and left (yasi and his family)
fo.bo nä kar.ma thwam.nzə.rəm ni.ma saf.sə.ma
other people settled there, like from safs
saf.sə.ma wo.ga nä fo.bo swam.nzə.rəm gə.fi yəf
there was one person from safs, his name was gfi
maf.ne.mä.wä ba.mu yə thə.bi.thə ze.na maf.ne.mä.wä ʔe.rä
ngéfi Father of bamu Father of thémbithé
his father was bamu, but really thbithé. they are really his children
fi zə zen.fa.ra ʔa.ne kay.ʔə ni.ma
nḡefi who was from safés had left before the headhunter from safés started the fight
kay.ʔə zan zra.rä fi zə zen.fa.ra fi ʔa.ne.ma tər.tha ze.na zəf ʔe.rä
tomorrow will be the attack. and he already left. that is why they (his children) are still alive
fi fə.thə nyamnzrm na.fä.sü kwa thrä.kwə.rə.məth
if he had still lived there just before. with him they should have been killed
ka.be fo.bo nä fir.ran ma.ne ʔe.re.ra
as for some of the other people who were in firra
ka.be kar.ma ma.ne ʔäm.nza fi zə thä.kwrath fo.bo na.fä thäth.frath
people from other villages who lived there, they were also killed and mixed up with them.
only those two survived (yasi and srank)
ya.si.fa fo.ba fof ni za.ne ze.wä.ra.ke ze.na zən.rä

wäsi = crack; tätü wéwäntsé = I am cracking the coconut. nämbi wawa féthé tsawón fomba fóf kwa ngawäntséréth tüfér wawa.tsawón = you plant it, when you plant one yam, from there they will "sich vermehren"
we originate from Yasi, from that time, and here we are today.
nzen.me ŋaf.yə ber.na nzo.ne ŋa.fe kwo.thi
they were ours fathers. my father kwozi
fi tər.tha ber.na sra.nək nə.ge.mä.re zäb.tha
there were alive, but srank died without children.
ŋa.re fə.fə ze.fa.fa fi nə.ge.mär ba.na ya.ra
he did get married, but the poor guy was without children
ʔau.si fäth mä re.ra ʔa.ne zan mər.mə.ren na.fa.ne yəf zaf.go
there was one woman in the war. here name was zafgo
zafo, she was from akrimogo, zafo
fi ma.ne re.ra math.math ga.mo zä.zi.ra na.si yə.fön zäth.ba
math math nḡamo = hiding spell, invisibility spell;
she used a hiding spell and went into the hole of a long yam
the headhunters just passed by without taking notice
zinbraksi = they went away, went past; ŋazinbrakwrth = if no; zazinbrath (they passed her (in the hole))
when the head hunters had passed
fi fə.thə fof zän.mä.tra na.si yə.fö.fa ʔa.kri.mo.go
she came out of the long yam hole (and went) to akrimogo
he was a big man from firra
wa.tik fo.bo fof mi.ya.tha zä.ko.rath oh fir.ran zə thä.kwə.rəth
then, they really knew: "they killed them in firra"
ŋar.sen kə.ma the.thrä.fath fi zə za.fö.wä zä.ri.ta.koth
they tried to block them at the river, but they had crossed earlier.
they talked in wartha language and in kancha
wä.ra zo.kwa.si wo.ga nä fo.ba ya.ri.za
she heard one guy in wära language
thräkési = stop, block; he stopped (them) for her
a man who spoke stopping (the others from killing hus) sister
nzo.ne yə.moth fob rä ma.fo kə.mam zeth.fro
"nzone emóth fombo rä maf kmam zathaféro" = if on kómntso; thafrakési = mix
"my sister is over there, who you must not put her together with the others."
na.fad.ba ʔa.ne ʔau.si fäthdba mi.ya.tha zo.kwa.si fof za.tho.rath ni.ma
from the little woman the knowledge spread (and the people said) like this:
?o.kay ke.ke za.gər wo.ga za.nər thwa.ni.yak fi zə.ba zə.rä saf.sə.ma wo.ga thwa.ni.yak
"okay, there did not come from far away to kill. there are from close by, from safs.
okay, the revenge that took place
ne.zä faw zə wə.bri.gər.nath nzen.me ʔa.ki
whose (grandchild) is the local council member today.
bä.ne.ma na.fan.me may.ʔa.wa ka.ka.far zə bra.mö.wä thä.kwrath fir.ran
because all their big mayawas were killed in firra
na.fa.ne ʔa.ne ʔe.bar ma.ne re.ra faw.ka.rä.sü re.ra
ne.zä ma.ne ʔe.re.ra za.gər ke.ke ʔe.ya.ka ma.ne nə me.re.fo the.mi.ya.rath ne.zä faw me.re.ma wo.ga kə.ma thrä.kwə.rə.məth
miyasi miyantsési = pick up (but in this case to go FOR them, kill them); they though first that the headhunter had come from mere (bit further), but really they were from safés
for that revenge they did not go far. they tried to killed the people in mere. they should have killed the people from mere for the revenge
the killed the safs people in nzrari
kər.si zə.nen fo.bo fof the.thrä.fath fo.bo fof thä.kwrath
thräkési = stop sb.; kérsi = block ekérkwé; thäkérthé
they stopped them at the blocking place. and they killed them over there.
ʔa.ne ʔe.bar ni.ma.me fir.ran fof re.ra ʔa.ne
the headhunting was like this in firra
fo.ba.fa ma.ne rä fo.bo fof ker.ker kwan.bə.tha.krəm ʔa.ne fof
that side, over there was the end of it
ʔe.ba.ra.ne zan zəf.rä.rəm fof wo.ga thuf.nzə.rə.məth
head hunting really happened. they killed the people
thwärtmth = iterative, otherwise is should be: thärtmth
they always cut the heads. they carried them ...
entama = from the second; the fourth time "asarane"
that was the second time. (the revenge was the second time)
ʔa.ne fof re.ra last fe.fe mä zer.mä.na feth.ka.ka.ren zə.bo ma.ne thä.kwrath
the very last headhunting was at fethka kar. they killed them there
feth.ka.kar ka.ren fə.thə thä.kwrath nä.bi fə.thə fof ze.ma.tha.koth
in fethka kar when they killed them, they ran away for good
because of this we are here today.
zo.kwa.si fə.thə zə maf kra.tri.kwro fi
ze.na mər.mə.ren fə.thə ni.nə wə.bri.gwre nä.bu.nə
ni = niné (really us) = ninä (with us) ninrr ninzrr = ninzä
within today when we recall it or other ones
fə.thə zə.mar.wə.re za.ne nzen.me kar mər.mə.ren thəd mo.re.he.ʔa.den
when you see here inside our village in morehead
ni.ma.me kre.naf.thə.mə thəd mo.re.he.ʔa.den kar ma.ne ʔe.rä
I will tell you in the middle of morehead, those are the villages (where people came from)
bä.ne.ma nzen.me thə.den ʔa.ne fof kwa.kwi.rəm wo.ga fi.nzo fi.nzo kwaf.nzə.rə.məth
because this was going on in our midst, people were killing each other
nä kar wo.ga.nə nä kar thwe.mi.ya.rəth
some village people attacked other villages again and again
nä kar wo.ga.nə nä kar wo.ga thwe.mi.ya.rəth
and again others attack other village people
nzen.me mər.mə.ren ni.ma fof ŋa.kwi.ra yam
in our clan this took place
ʔa.ne.ma ka.be.ka.rä.sü ni nə.re.ra ni mə.rən.mä.wä nə.re.ra
because of that, we were with our people. we were really from that clan
fir.ran ma.ne thä.kwrath ma.ne wo.ga fi fə.fə zäb.thath
in firra, the people that were killed. they really finished the people
na.fa.ne sə.to.rəy ni.ma.me fir.ra.ŋa.ne fof rä bə.rä
the story is like this, about firra
nä ke.ke ma.ne fä kwa sath.fä.ra ʔa.ne.nzo ni.nzo fe.fe nzə.neth.fä.ra
over there, no one was spared. only we were left.
yasi's family (and) here we are today
nzen.me mə.rən mər.mə.ren zə mon.me mi.ya.tha ŋa.kwir
in our family, the knowledge about this already spread
gad.me.wä fi zə.bo kom.nzo ʔäm.rə.na kar.bu ʔo.te
luckily, they stayed back here, ote and karbu
fir.ra.nzo bä bə.thra.rä.rəm ma.ne fə.thə zə thrä.kwə.rə.məth fo.bo fof
if they were there, they would be already killed there
we should not be many (like we are now)
fi mon zə.bo ʔäm.rə.na ya.sif ʔa.ne fof fam thən.ra
karémbu and ote; fam enrén (if now); enrénéth (they think of those two)
how they stayed here. yasi thought of them.
nafénemäwä = his own clan; nafénmemäwä = really their
my father was the only one (from him)
fo.bo fof wəy.thik ʔa.ne bä.ne zo.kwa.si fof
it is not a long story, the head hunting story from firra
ni.ma kerkeren ʔe.fo.then zəf.wi.ya.kəm mon.wä zə nzə.na.naf.thə.mə
like in the last days (of the headhunting) it went, how I have just told you.
it was going on in the last days (of headhunting)
(this was) also when the white man came in
from then on it came to an end
ʔe.bar zan fə.thə di.bu.ra fa.tha.si theth.kä.fath ma.fa ʔa.ne
the headhunting. that is when they started to lock up people who
this has come to an end
this has come to an end
